alert.note: Alert for Catalina and Santa Barbara Islands; Santa Clarita Valley (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued December 19 at 2:54PM PST until December 23 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 PM PST THIS EVENING THROUGH LATE THURSDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...The high risk of flooding caused by excessive rainfall. * WHERE...All of Los Angeles, Ventura, Santa Barbara, and San Luis Obispo Counties in Southwest California. * WHEN...From 10 PM PST this evening through late Thursday night. * IMPACTS...This is a high risk for flooding of extensive roadway flooding, especially in low-lying areas, including rock and mudslide activity on canyon and mountain roadways. Significant travel delays and road closures should be expected. There is a risk for flash flooding and debris flows in recent burn scars, especially the South Fire burn scar in Ventura County. Significant creek flooding is expected, with enhanced river flows and a low but present risk of flooding in the Ventura River. Swiftwater rescues are expected. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Periods of moderate to heavy rain and a chance of thunderstorms are expected with the upcoming storm system. Total rainfall estimates are 2 to 4 inches for most of the forecast area, with 4 to 8 inches possible across south facing foothills and coastal slopes. Rainfall rates of 0.30 to 0.60 inches per hour are expected to be common, with isolated rates up to 1.00 inch per hour possible near thunderstorms and favored south facing slopes. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Catalina and Santa Barbara Islands; Santa Clarita Valley
